name: Rythu Bandhu Scheme
description: A flagship scheme of the Andhra Pradesh government providing investment support to farmers for purchasing inputs like seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.
eligibility: All farmers owning cultivable land in Andhra Pradesh are eligible. The scheme covers both tenant farmers and landowners.
benefits: Provides Rs. 5,000 per acre per season (kharif and rabi) directly to the farmer's bank account. Supports sustainable agriculture practices.
application: Farmers need to register through the village secretariat or online portal. Applications are processed annually before each cropping season.

name: Rythu Bharosa Scheme
description: Provides financial assistance to farmers affected by natural calamities, crop failures, and other unforeseen circumstances.
eligibility: Farmers who have suffered crop loss due to natural disasters, droughts, or floods. Must be registered with the revenue department.
benefits: Compensation ranging from Rs. 5,000 to Rs. 15,000 per acre depending on the extent of damage. Quick disbursement within 7-10 days of verification.
application: Report crop damage to the local revenue officer or through the Rythu Bharosa app. Submit necessary documents like land records and damage assessment reports.

name: Andhra Pradesh Crop Insurance Scheme
description: Comprehensive crop insurance covering various risks including drought, flood, pest attacks, and disease outbreaks for major crops.
eligibility: All farmers growing notified crops in Andhra Pradesh. Premium is shared between central and state governments.
benefits: Full compensation for crop loss up to the sum insured. Covers both yield loss and prevented sowing. Premium subsidy up to 90% for small and marginal farmers.
application: Enroll through banks, cooperative societies, or online portals during the sowing season. Automatic coverage for loanee farmers.

name: Rythu Sadhikara Samajam
description: Promotes farmer producer organizations and cooperative societies to enhance bargaining power and provide better market access.
eligibility: Groups of farmers forming cooperatives or producer companies. Minimum 50 members required for registration.
benefits: Access to credit, inputs at discounted rates, collective marketing, and value addition facilities. Government support for infrastructure development.
application: Register through the Department of Agriculture. Submit bylaws, member details, and business plan. Training and capacity building provided.

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
description: Promotes organic farming practices and sustainable agriculture in clusters to improve soil health and farmer income.
eligibility: Farmers willing to adopt organic farming. Clusters of 50 acres minimum for group certification.
benefits: Financial assistance of Rs. 50,000 per hectare for organic inputs and certification. Premium price realization for organic produce.
application: Apply through the District Agriculture Officer. Prepare cluster development plan and get organic certification from accredited agencies.

name: Talliki Vandanam
description: A scheme providing financial assistance to students in government and private schools from classes I to XII to support their education.
eligibility: Students enrolled in classes I to XII in government and private schools in Andhra Pradesh.
benefits: Provides Rs. 15,000 per year per student directly to the beneficiary's account.
application: Students or parents can apply through the school or online portal. Verification through school records.

name: Annadata Sukhibhava
description: A scheme offering annual financial support to farmers to enhance their livelihood and agricultural activities.
eligibility: All registered farmers in Andhra Pradesh owning cultivable land.
benefits: Provides Rs. 20,000 per year per farmer directly to their bank account.
application: Farmers need to register through the village secretariat or online portal with land records.

name: D-Krishi
description: An Aadhaar-enabled system for efficient and transparent distribution of seeds to farmers.
eligibility: Farmers registered with Aadhaar and owning cultivable land in Andhra Pradesh.
benefits: Ensures timely and quality seed distribution through digital tracking and subsidies.
application: Register through the D-Krishi portal using Aadhaar. Select seeds and apply for distribution.

name: Paddy Procurement System
description: A government initiative to procure paddy from farmers at fair prices to ensure market stability and farmer income.
eligibility: Farmers growing paddy in Andhra Pradesh who meet quality standards.
benefits: Guaranteed procurement at minimum support price (MSP) with timely payments.
application: Farmers can sell paddy at designated procurement centers. Register harvest details in advance.

name: Super Six Schemes
description: A comprehensive package including financial aid for women, free bus travel, youth employment, and unemployment assistance.
eligibility: Women aged 19-59 for financial aid and bus travel; youth for jobs; unemployed individuals for aid.
benefits: Rs. 1,500 per month for eligible women; free bus travel for women; 20 lakh jobs for youth; Rs. 3,000 per month unemployment aid.
application: Apply through respective departments: women through social welfare, youth through employment exchanges, unemployed through labor department.

name: NTR Weavers Pension (Rural)
description: Pension scheme for rural weavers who are destitute and above 65 years to provide financial security.
eligibility: Rural weavers aged 65 and above who are destitute and have been engaged in weaving.
benefits: Monthly pension amount as per government norms to support livelihood.
application: Apply through the Department of Handlooms and Textiles with proof of age, income, and weaving occupation.

name: NTR Old Age Pension (Urban)
description: Pension scheme for urban destitute elderly aged 65 and above to ensure basic financial support.
eligibility: Urban residents aged 65 and above who are destitute with no other income sources.
benefits: Monthly pension amount as per government norms.
application: Apply through the Social Welfare Department with age proof and income certificates.
